adrFormatAddress: 335 12th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: in the early 2000s I started working for air Pegasus heliport and fell in love with helicopters the fact that you can work with a helicopter is amazing it's self but the best part was the owners and Brian Tolbert showed me that doing what u love is not a job so have fun and be safe.and the importance of a passengers life is in our hands when there on the ramp so safety first no matter what. they treated me like family and I will always remember them for that. I work for a airport f.b.o now with privet jets but in a heart beat I will always wanna work for air Pegasus heliport the staff  and owners are amazing people to work with.i wanna say thank u to the whole air Pegasus heliport team for showing me a love for aviation thank u so much...and Brian Tolbert for given me a chance and showing me the way... god bless

I work for a airport f.b.o now with privet jets but in a heart beat I will always wanna work for air Pegasus heliport the staff  and owners are amazing people to work with.i wanna say thank u to the whole air Pegasus heliport team for showing me a love for aviation thank u so much...and Brian Tolbert for given me a chance and showing me the way... god bless

originalText.text:
It's a fun experience to ride on chopper even if we know it's noisy. Not all but staff at the entrance, pilot and the staff who made the video Tim, was great. Tim was fantastic, very patient as we had the little ones too and very very cooperative. Others were just ok not so tolerant to little ones around, they missed taking our photos that was part of the deal we got so we had to go all the way back outside in the noise, they were then behaving as if they are doing a favor to us by allowing to go again instead of being "sorry". It was because of them that we had to go all the way with kids but we had to have fun so we had it. :) the videographer Tim was the only kind person who understood how difficult it was for little one, he apologized and he even came all the way with us to make sure we get it done second time. He was excellent! The lady at the little shop who sells photos too was absolutely insensitive, rude. She said if you are groupon deal it's weird you even got to take photos on your phone, she clearly didn't know what she was talking. Anyway she wasn't good at all. Other than that it was considerable ok.
Later I came to know about tip there but I didn't see anybody doing that. I wish I had given tip to videographer for being so amazing.

originalText.text: Location. Location. Location. The heliport itself is no frills but landing to the edge of Manhattan what more do you need than a safe place to land and get fuel? Nothing other than nice ground support to accomodate your stop and they have that covered.

text.text: Location. Location. Location. The heliport itself is no frills but landing to the edge of Manhattan what more do you need than a safe place to land and get fuel? Nothing other than nice ground support to accomodate your stop and they have that covered.

originalText.text: Noisy, polluting, disruptive, and absurdly expensive, I believe such helicopter service should be banned from urban areas. Let the owners live under constantly buzzing helicopters.

text.text: Noisy, polluting, disruptive, and absurdly expensive, I believe such helicopter service should be banned from urban areas. Let the owners live under constantly buzzing helicopters.

originalText.text: I fly here weekly and appreciate the staff in loading and unloading the helicopter with promptness and safety.

text.text: I fly here weekly and appreciate the staff in loading and unloading the helicopter with promptness and safety.
